satisfy.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to make someone feel pleased by doing what they want
satisfy.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Nothing I did would ever satisfy my father.
satisfy.translation[0].definitions[1].de: if you satisfy someone’s needs, demands etc, you provide what they need or want
satisfy.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Just to satisfy my curiosity  (=find out something), how much did it cost?
The program is designed to satisfy the needs of adult learners.
A salad won’t be enough to satisfy my appetite.
satisfy.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to make someone feel sure that something is right or true
satisfy.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Jackson tried to satisfy me of his innocence.
Having satisfied herself that no one was there, she closed the door.
satisfy.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to be good enough for a particular purpose, standard etc
satisfy.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Have you satisfied all the requirements for the general degree?
satisfy.translation[0].note_box[0].headi: – Meaning 2: if you satisfy someone’s needs, demands etc, you provide what they need or want
satisfy.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: Education must satisfy the needs of its pupils.
The company was unable to satisfy demand for the product.
They don't get enough food to satisfy their appetite.
It is difficult to satisfy a desire for power.
Her urge to travel had never been satisfied.
I had to read the letter, just to satisfy my curiosity.
We work hard to satisfy customers' wants.
The new government failed to satisfy the aspirations of the people.
I needed to satisfy my cravings for chocolate.
satisfy.translation[0].note_box[1].headi: – Meaning 4: to be good enough for a particular purpose, standard etc
satisfy.translation[0].note_box[1].secti: The application must satisfy the requirements of Article 6.
Free treatment is available providing that two conditions are satisfied.
These programmes permit students to enter higher education without satisfying all the admissions criteria.
